snippet: As part of a broad effort to improve Internet access, President Obama will ask the commission to overrule state laws that limit the expansion of local high-speed networks.
abstract: Pres Obama will call on Federal Communications Commission to to overrule state laws restricting competition among Internet service providers and preventing communities from expanding high-speed service into rural areas; changes are crucial to Obama's plan to allow for greater ISP innovation and to bring United States in line with other countries that have faster connections on average.
lead_paragraph: As part of a broad effort to improve Internet access, President Obama will ask the commission to overrule state laws that limit the expansion of local high-speed networks.

headline.main: Obama Will Urge F.C.C. to Aid Local Broadband Expansion
headline.print_headline: Obama Will Urge F.C.C. to Aid Local Broadband Expansion
